item.title: Report E-2023070167
item.description:
Report E-2023070167

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-26T15:11:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: WAITE PARK
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XBD notified ERTS of a UN1824 "Met-All Terj" release from a 330-gallon poly tote. Terminal personnel declined contractor assistance as the cap was loose releasing half a gallon of product which evaporated. There was no release to cleanup. The tote was secured for shipment onto the consignee.

item.title: Report E-2023070075
item.description:
Report E-2023070075

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-24T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-13
  • City: EAGAN
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one metal 55 gallon drum of resin (un2290) had ben damaged by a sharp object and had released 0.5 cups of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023061649
item.description:
Report X-2023061649

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-24T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged package was refused by the recipient and brought back to the station by the driver. an unload manager found it in the unload around 6pm and called out for QA to come retrieve it. HESS specialist responded and placed it in a lined tote, bringing it back to the damage area and placing it atop the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one bottle leaked due to loose cap. the cap was found completely off. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report E-2023070051
item.description:
Report E-2023070051

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-09
  • City: FRIDLEY
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 5 gallon pails of A-1000 Supplement (un1814) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 cup of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023061599
item.description:
Report X-2023061599

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA admin was upstairs checking the sorter when he discovered a damaged package with suspicious staining on the torn box. He brought it downstairs and placed it in a lined tote on the drain mats for the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. HESS specialist inspected the contents and confirmed that the product is regulated. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one bottle leaked due to loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023061590
item.description:
Report X-2023061590

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: around 6pm yesterday, a QA admin discovered the damaged hazmat sitting by door 13 in the unload. It is not known when an unloader discovered it other than earlier that day. QA admin placed it in a lined tote and brought it over to the damage area, placing it atop the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: two bottles leaked due to loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats
